result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith W Garafalo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run AMENDED FROM Felony Hit and run-injury, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay the fine and costs or spend 10 days in jail.
Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Hit and Run AMENDED FROM Felony Hit and run-injury
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Keith W Garafalo in court with attorney John A Cabranes.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
